channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: SBCFormer: Lightweight Network Capable of Full-size ImageNet Classification at 1 FPS on Single Board Computers
item.description: For the first time, it achieves an ImageNet-1K top-1 accuracy of around 80% at a speed of 1. 0 frame/sec on the SBC.

item.title: Context Shift Reduction for Offline Meta-Reinforcement Learning
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel approach called Context Shift Reduction for OMRL (CSRO) to address the context shift problem with only offline datasets.

item.title: Rethinking and Improving Multi-task Learning for End-to-end Speech Translation
item.description: Significant improvements in end-to-end speech translation (ST) have been achieved through the application of multi-task learning.

item.title: Bilingual Corpus Mining and Multistage Fine-Tuning for Improving Machine Translation of Lecture Transcripts
item.description: To create the parallel corpora, we propose a dynamic programming based sentence alignment algorithm which leverages the cosine similarity of machine-translated sentences.

item.title: Formulating Discrete Probability Flow Through Optimal Transport
item.description: In this paper, we aim to establish the fundamental theory for the probability flow of discrete diffusion models.

item.title: HyperS2V: A Framework for Structural Representation of Nodes in Hyper Networks
item.description: The results underscore the superior performance of HyperS2V in terms of both interpretability and applicability to downstream tasks.

item.title: Gender Inflected or Bias Inflicted: On Using Grammatical Gender Cues for Bias Evaluation in Machine Translation
item.description: Most of the work on evaluating gender bias in NMT has focused primarily on English as the source language.

item.title: Conversations in Galician: a Large Language Model for an Underrepresented Language
item.description: Additionally, as a demonstration of the dataset utility, we fine-tuned LLaMA-7B to comprehend and respond in Galician, a language not originally supported by the model, by following the Alpaca format.

item.title: Cup Curriculum: Curriculum Learning on Model Capacity
item.description: Curriculum learning (CL) aims to increase the performance of a learner on a given task by applying a specialized learning strategy.

item.title: Mini but Mighty: Finetuning ViTs with Mini Adapters
item.description: Vision Transformers (ViTs) have become one of the dominant architectures in computer vision, and pre-trained ViT models are commonly adapted to new tasks via fine-tuning.

item.title: Loss Balancing for Fair Supervised Learning
item.description: Imposing EL on the learning process leads to a non-convex optimization problem even if the loss function is convex, and the existing fair learning algorithms cannot properly be adopted to find the fair predictor under the EL constraint.

item.title: Proceedings of the 5th International Workshop on Reading Music Systems
item.description: The International Workshop on Reading Music Systems (WoRMS) is a workshop that tries to connect researchers who develop systems for reading music, such as in the field of Optical Music Recognition, with other researchers and practitioners that could benefit from such systems, like librarians or musicologists.

item.title: Aspects of human memory and Large Language Models
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) are huge artificial neural networks which primarily serve to generate text, but also provide a very sophisticated probabilistic model of language use.

item.title: JPAVE: A Generation and Classification-based Model for Joint Product Attribute Prediction and Value Extraction
item.description: Furthermore, the copy mechanism in value generator and the value attention module in value classifier help our model address the data discrepancy issue by only focusing on the relevant part of input text and ignoring other information which causes the discrepancy issue such as sentence structure in the text.

item.title: JaSPICE: Automatic Evaluation Metric Using Predicate-Argument Structures for Image Captioning Models
item.description: Image captioning studies heavily rely on automatic evaluation metrics such as BLEU and METEOR.

item.title: Unified Low-Resource Sequence Labeling by Sample-Aware Dynamic Sparse Finetuning
item.description: Unfortunately, this requires formatting them into specialized augmented format unknown to the base pretrained language model (PLMs) necessitating finetuning to the target format.

item.title: Do LLMs exhibit human-like response biases? A case study in survey design
item.description: In this work, we use survey design as a case study, where human response biases caused by permutations in wordings of ``prompts'' have been extensively studied.

item.title: Multilingual Mathematical Autoformalization
item.description: In this work, we create $\texttt{MMA}$, a large, flexible, multilingual, and multi-domain dataset of informal-formal pairs, by using a language model to translate in the reverse direction, that is, from formal mathematical statements into corresponding informal ones.

item.title: RobustMat: Neural Diffusion for Street Landmark Patch Matching under Challenging Environments
item.description: For autonomous vehicles (AVs), visual perception techniques based on sensors like cameras play crucial roles in information acquisition and processing.

item.title: Black-Box Prompt Optimization: Aligning Large Language Models without Model Training
item.description: However, these models are often not well aligned with human intents, which calls for additional treatments on them, that is, the alignment problem.

item.title: FLORA: Fine-grained Low-Rank Architecture Search for Vision Transformer
item.description: With our method, a more fine-grained rank configuration can be generated automatically and yield up to 33% extra FLOPs reduction compared to a simple uniform configuration.

item.title: Improving Korean NLP Tasks with Linguistically Informed Subword Tokenization and Sub-character Decomposition
item.description: We introduce a morpheme-aware subword tokenization method that utilizes sub-character decomposition to address the challenges of applying Byte Pair Encoding (BPE) to Korean, a language characterized by its rich morphology and unique writing system.

item.title: Multi-view Information Integration and Propagation for Occluded Person Re-identification
item.description: Moreover, as multiple images with the same identity are not accessible in the testing stage, we devise an Information Propagation (IP) mechanism to distill knowledge from the comprehensive representation to that of a single occluded image.

item.title: A Simple Interpretable Transformer for Fine-Grained Image Classification and Analysis
item.description: Unlike mainstream classifiers that wait until the last fully-connected layer to incorporate class information to make predictions, we investigate a proactive approach, asking each class to search for itself in an image.

item.title: Video Instance Matting
item.description: To remedy this deficiency, we propose Video Instance Matting~(VIM), that is, estimating alpha mattes of each instance at each frame of a video sequence.

item.title: SeRO: Self-Supervised Reinforcement Learning for Recovery from Out-of-Distribution Situations
item.description: Moreover, we show that our method can retrain the agent to recover from OOD situations even when in-distribution states are difficult to visit through exploration.

item.title: GLaMM: Pixel Grounding Large Multimodal Model
item.description: In this work, we present Grounding LMM (GLaMM), the first model that can generate natural language responses seamlessly intertwined with corresponding object segmentation masks.

item.title: Practical considerations for variable screening in the Super Learner
item.description: However, the performance of a Super Learner using the lasso for dimension reduction has not been fully explored in cases where the lasso is known to perform poorly.

item.title: Nonparametric modeling of the composite effect of multiple nutrients on blood glucose dynamics
item.description: By differentiating treatment components, incorporating their dosages, and sharing statistical information across patients via a hierarchical multi-output Gaussian process, our method improves prediction accuracy over existing approaches, and allows us to interpret the different effects of carbohydrates and fat on the overall glucose response.

item.title: Cal-DETR: Calibrated Detection Transformer
item.description: Third, we develop a logit mixing approach that acts as a regularizer with detection-specific losses and is also complementary to the uncertainty-guided logit modulation technique to further improve the calibration performance.

item.title: Pseudo-Labeling for Domain-Agnostic Bangla Automatic Speech Recognition
item.description: Our results demonstrate the efficacy of the model trained on psuedo-label data for the designed test-set along with publicly-available Bangla datasets.

item.title: APGL4SR: A Generic Framework with Adaptive and Personalized Global Collaborative Information in Sequential Recommendation
item.description: To this end, we propose a graph-driven framework, named Adaptive and Personalized Graph Learning for Sequential Recommendation (APGL4SR), that incorporates adaptive and personalized global collaborative information into sequential recommendation systems.

item.title: TabRepo: A Large Scale Repository of Tabular Model Evaluations and its AutoML Applications
item.description: TabRepo contains the predictions and metrics of 1206 models evaluated on 200 regression and classification datasets.

item.title: Plug-and-Play Stability for Intracortical Brain-Computer Interfaces: A One-Year Demonstration of Seamless Brain-to-Text Communication
item.description: Our results provide the first evidence for long-term stabilization of a plug-and-play, high-performance communication iBCI, addressing a major barrier for the clinical translation of iBCIs.

item.title: OVIR-3D: Open-Vocabulary 3D Instance Retrieval Without Training on 3D Data
item.description: This work presents OVIR-3D, a straightforward yet effective method for open-vocabulary 3D object instance retrieval without using any 3D data for training.

item.title: Edge2Node: Reducing Edge Prediction to Node Classification
item.description: A common approach for edge prediction is to first obtain the embeddings of two nodes, and then a predefined scoring function is used to predict the existence of an edge between the two nodes.

item.title: CogVLM: Visual Expert for Pretrained Language Models
item.description: We introduce CogVLM, a powerful open-source visual language foundation model.

item.title: Hopfield-Enhanced Deep Neural Networks for Artifact-Resilient Brain State Decoding
item.description: In this study, we propose a two-stage computational framework combining Hopfield Networks for artifact data preprocessing with Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) for classification of brain states in rat neural recordings under different levels of anesthesia.

item.title: TSP-Transformer: Task-Specific Prompts Boosted Transformer for Holistic Scene Understanding
item.description: Holistic scene understanding includes semantic segmentation, surface normal estimation, object boundary detection, depth estimation, etc.

item.title: Deep Image Semantic Communication Model for Artificial Intelligent Internet of Things
item.description: Particularly, at the transmitter side, a high-precision image semantic segmentation algorithm is proposed to extract the semantic information of the image to achieve significant compression of the image data.

item.title: A universal framework for accurate and efficient geometric deep learning of molecular systems
item.description: Molecular sciences address a wide range of problems involving molecules of different types and sizes and their complexes.

item.title: BanLemma: A Word Formation Dependent Rule and Dictionary Based Bangla Lemmatizer
item.description: Lemmatization holds significance in both natural language processing (NLP) and linguistics, as it effectively decreases data density and aids in comprehending contextual meaning.

item.title: A survey and classification of face alignment methods based on face models
item.description: Face alignment is the process of fitting the landmarks in a face model to the respective ground truth positions in an input image containing a face.

item.title: Estimating treatment effects from single-arm trials via latent-variable modeling
item.description: Compared to previous methods, our results show improved performance both for direct treatment effect estimation as well as for effect estimation via patient matching.

item.title: DeepInception: Hypnotize Large Language Model to Be Jailbreaker
item.description: Despite remarkable success in various applications, large language models (LLMs) are vulnerable to adversarial jailbreaks that make the safety guardrails void.

item.title: Variational Weighting for Kernel Density Ratios
item.description: Kernel density estimation (KDE) is integral to a range of generative and discriminative tasks in machine learning.

item.title: FATE: Feature-Agnostic Transformer-based Encoder for learning generalized embedding spaces in flow cytometry data
item.description: This limitation becomes particularly relevant in scenarios where the attributes captured during data acquisition vary across different samples.

item.title: Dynamic Neural Fields for Learning Atlases of 4D Fetal MRI Time-series
item.description: We apply our method to learning subject-specific atlases and motion stabilization of dynamic BOLD MRI time-series of fetuses in utero.

item.title: Mini Minds: Exploring Bebeshka and Zlata Baby Models
item.description: In this paper, we describe the University of Lyon 2 submission to the Strict-Small track of the BabyLM competition.

item.title: GLEN: Generative Retrieval via Lexical Index Learning
item.description: For training, GLEN effectively exploits a dynamic lexical identifier using a two-phase index learning strategy, enabling it to learn meaningful lexical identifiers and relevance signals between queries and documents.
